definition: contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: The reactionary elements attempt to set back the clock of history. They're doomed to failure.
sentences.chinese: 反动分子企图使历史倒退，他们是注定要失败的。

sentences.english: A radical critic of society has turned into a High-Church reactionary.
sentences.chinese: 一个激进的社会批评家变成了高教会派的反动分子。

sentences.english: We should not be overcautious or too afraid of reactionaries sneaking in.
sentences.chinese: 不要畏首畏尾，惧怕反动分子混进来。

definition: local bosses, shady gentry (idiom); dominant local mafia
Communist Party/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3]
capitalist roader (person in power taking the capitalist road, a political label often pinned on cadres by the Red Guards during the Cultural Revolution)
communist bandit (i.e. PLA soldier (during the civil war) or Chinese communist (Tw))
